sen.j: 東寺長者（とうじちょうじゃ）は、東寺（教王護国寺）の管理者・長官である僧侶の呼称。
sen.e: To-ji Choja is the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple (Kyoogokoku-ji Temple), and acts as Manager and Kami (director) of the temple.
To-ji Choja is the chief abbot of To-ji Temple (Kyoogokoku-ji Temple), and acts as its manager and Kami (director).
To-ji Choja is the chief abbot of To-ji Temple (Kyoogokoku-ji Temple), and acts as its manager and Kami (director).

sen.j: 真言宗の最高位としての権威を兼ね備えた。
sen.e: To-ji Choja is the highest ranking authority of the Shingon sect.
To-ji Choja is the highest-ranking authority of the Shingon sect.
To-ji Choja is the highest-ranking authority of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 正式には単に長者（ちょうじゃ）と呼ばれているが、氏長者と紛らわしいために「東寺長者」と呼ばれることが多い。
sen.e: To-ji Choja is simply called Choja as an official name. But Choja is often called To-ji Choja because Choja is confused with uji no choja (the head of the clan).
To-ji Choja is simply called Choja as an official name, but Choja is often called To-ji Choja because Choja is confused with uji no choja (the head of the clan).
To-ji Choja is simply called Choja as an official name, but Choja is often called To-ji Choja because Choja is confused with uji no choja (the head of the clan).

sen.j: 初代長者は実恵。
sen.e: The first To-ji Choja was Jichie (Jitsue).
The first To-ji Choja was Jichie (Jitsue).
The first To-ji Choja was Jichie (also pronounced Jitsue).

sen.j: 真言宗を開いた空海の御遺告（ごゆいごう、遺言）に従って承和 (日本)3年（836年）に実恵が任命されたのが最初である。
sen.e: Jichie was appointed as the first To-ji Choja in 836 according to the goyuigo (will) of Kukai, who established the Shingon sect.
Jichie was appointed as the first To-ji Choja in 836, according to the goyuigo (will) of Kukai, who established the Shingon sect.
Jichie was appointed as the first To-ji Choja in 836, according to the goyuigo (will) of Kukai, who established the Shingon sect.

sen.j: ただし、今日において真言宗及び東寺では、空海をもって初代東寺別当としている。
sen.e: However, the Shingon sect and the To-ji Temple now consider Kukai as the first To-ji betto (the head priest of the To-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: 「初代東寺別当」は、the first To-ji betto (the head priest of To-ji Temple)としました。
sen.e: However, the Shingon sect and To-ji Temple now consider Kukai as the first To-ji betto (head priest of To-ji Temple).
However, the Shingon sect and To-ji Temple now consider Kukai as the first To-ji betto (head priest of To-ji Temple).

sen.j: これは弘仁14年1月19日 (旧暦)に嵯峨天皇が空海に建設中の東寺を与えてその建設責任者である「造東寺所別当」に任命したことに由来する。
sen.e: This derives from the fact that Emperor Gosaga bestowed the To-ji Temple being under construction on Kukai on January 19, 823, and appointed him as the chief of the constructing department of the To-ji Temple..

This derives from the fact that Emperor Gosaga bestowed To-ji Temple (then under construction) on Kukai on January 19, 823, and appointed him as the chief of the construction department of To-ji Temple.
This derives from the fact that Emperor Saga bestowed To-ji Temple (then under construction) on Kukai on March 9, 823, and appointed him as the chief of the construction department of To-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリ暦に

sen.j: もっとも、東寺長者の役割を空海が遺した東寺を維持・管理・整備する責任者であると考えるならば、造東寺所別当を東寺長者の前身とみなして最初に東寺を整備した空海を初代と考えることも決して誤りではないと言える。
sen.e: Considering that the role of To-ji Choja is to act as a person in charge of the maintenance, management and improvement of the To-ji Temple, which Kukai left, it is not wrong at all to consider the chief of the constructing department of the To-ji Temple as the forerunner of To-ji Choja, and to consider Kukai, who helped construct the To-ji Temple, as the first To-ji betto.

Considering that the role of To-ji Choja is to be in charge of the maintenance, management and improvement of To-ji Temple, which Kukai left, it is not at all wrong to consider the chief of the construction department of To-ji Temple as the forerunner of To-ji Choja and to consider Kukai, who helped construct the To-ji Temple, as the first To-ji betto.

Considering that the role of To-ji Choja is to be in charge of the maintenance, management and improvement of To-ji Temple, which Kukai left, it is not at all wrong to consider the chief of the construction department of To-ji Temple as the forerunner of To-ji Choja and to consider Kukai, who helped construct the To-ji Temple, as the first To-ji betto.

sen.j: 以後、長者は真言宗の僧侶から選ばれ、後には仁和寺・大覚寺・勧修寺・醍醐寺（三宝院）の4寺の中から門跡の貴種が勅任される慣習が成立した。
sen.e: After that, Choja started to be selected from the priests of the Shingon sect, and a custom was later established for the emperor to appoint Choja from monzeki (a priest of a temple in which resided a member of nobility or imperial family) of noble birth of four temples (the Ninna-ji Temple, Daikaku-ji Temple, Kaju-ji Temple or Daigo-ji Temple (Sanbo-in)).
sen.cmt: この文における門跡は、門跡寺の住職という意味ですので、monzeki (a priest of a temple in which resided a member of nobility or the imperial family)としました。
sen.e: Subsequently, Choja were selected from the priests of the Shingon sect, and a custom was later established for the emperor to appoint Choja from monzeki (a priest of a temple in which resided a member of nobility or the Imperial Family) of noble birth of four temples (the Ninna-ji Temple, Daikaku-ji Temple, Kaju-ji Temple and Daigo-ji Temple (Sanbo-in)).

Subsequently, Choja were selected from the priests of the Shingon sect, and a custom was later established for the emperor to appoint Choja from monzeki (a priest of a temple in which resided a member of nobility or the Imperial Family) of noble birth of four temples (the Ninna-ji Temple, Daikaku-ji Temple, Kaju-ji Temple and Daigo-ji Temple (Sanbo-in)).

sen.j: また、延喜19年（919年）には観賢が東寺との対抗上、東寺長者とその権威を認めてこなかった同じ空海由来の金剛峯寺座主（別当）を兼ねたことでその権威は大いに高まった。
sen.e: Since 919 when Kangen also acted as the head priest (betto) of the Kongobuji Temple, which had not long recognized To-ji choja and his authority because of rivalry with the To-ji Temple, the authority of To-ji Choja was considerably strengthened.

Since 919, when Kangen also acted as the head priest (betto) of Kongobuji Temple, which due to rivalry hadn't long recognized To-ji choja and his authority, the authority of To-ji Choja was considerably strengthened.

Since 919, when Kangen also acted as the head priest (betto) of Kongobu-ji Temple, which due to rivalry hadn't long recognized To-ji choja and his authority, the authority of To-ji Choja was considerably strengthened.

sen.j: その後、御七日御修法の大阿闍梨の役目を務めるなど、宗派の代表としての役割を強化していった。
sen.e: After that, To-ji Choja acted as a Great Ajari for Shichinichi no Mishiho (seven days secret ceremony of severe prayer), and started to strengthen its role as a representative of the sect.
To-ji Choja then acted as the "Great Ajari" for Shichinichi no Mishiho (seven days' secret ceremony of severe prayer), and started to strengthen its role as a representative of the sect.
To-ji Choja then acted as the Great Ajari for Shichinichi no Mishiho (seven days' secret ceremony of severe prayer), and started to strengthen its role as a representative of the sect.

sen.j: その定員は初めは1名であったが、承和10年（843年）に2名、寛平7年（895年）には3名、安和2年（969年）には4名に増員された。
sen.e: One person was originally appointed as To-ji Choja, but the number of To-ji Choja was increased to two in 843, three in 895 and four in 969.
One person was originally appointed as To-ji Choja, but the number of To-ji Choja was increased to two in 843, three in 895 and four in 969.
One person was originally appointed as To-ji Choja, but the number of To-ji Choja was increased to two in 843, three in 895 and four in 969.

sen.j: そのうち最上位の長者は一長者あるいは一阿闍梨とも呼ばれて東寺の貫主（住職）として「寺務」を名乗るようになる。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The highest-ranked Choja was called Ichi no Choja (the highest-ranked chief abbot of the temple) or Ichi no Ajari (a highest-ranked master in Esoteric Buddhism; or the highest-ranked priest), and called himself the jimu (chief priest of Toji-dera kanzu)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 貞観_(日本)14年（872年）には僧綱の責任者である「法務」も兼ねる慣習が成立した。
sen.e: The highest-ranked Choja was called Ichi no Choja (a highest-ranked chief abbot of the temple), or Ichi no Ajari (a highest-ranked master in esoteric Buddhism; or a highest-ranked priest), and called himself as jimu (the chief priest of Toji-dera kanzu). Then in 872, a custom was established for him to double as homu, who was in charge of the Office of Monastic Affairs called Sogo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処一阿闍梨は、Ichi no Ajari (a highest-ranked master in esoteric Buddhism; or a highest-ranked priest)といたしました。
sen.e: The highest-ranked Choja was called Ichi no Choja (the highest-ranked chief abbot of the temple) or Ichi no Ajari (a highest-ranked master in Esoteric Buddhism; or the highest-ranked priest), and called himself the jimu (chief priest of Toji-dera kanzu); however, in 872 a custom was established for him to double as the homu, who was in charge of Sogo, or the Office of Monastic Affairs.
However, in 872 a custom was established for him to double as the homu, who was in charge of Sogo, or the Office of Monastic Affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: なお、勅任制度は明治維新によって廃止され、その後の真言宗の各宗派の分離に伴って、その地位は低下した。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The appointment system was abolished during the Meiji Restoration, and later its status was lowered due to the separation of the schools of the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: ただし、現在でも東寺真言宗の最高指導者として人々からの崇敬を集めている。
sen.e: The appointment system was abolished during the Meiji Restoration. After that, its status was lowered due to the separation of the schools of the Shingon sect, but Choja is still revered now by people as the supreme leader of the To-ji Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The appointment system was abolished during the Meiji Restoration, and later its status was lowered due to the separation of the schools of the Shingon sect; today, however, Choja is still revered by people as the supreme leader of the To-ji Shingon sect.
However, Choja is still revered by people as the supreme leader of the To-ji Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

tit.e: To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple))
To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple))
To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple))

sen.j: 東寺長者補任（とうじちょうじゃぶにん）とは、東寺長者次第（とうじちょうじゃしだい）とも呼ばれ、東寺の歴代の長者人事について記録した文書のこと。
sen.e: "To-ji Choja Bunin (records of To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple))," which is also called "To-ji Choja Shidai," is documents describing the personnel affairs of past To-ji Choja.
"To-ji Choja Bunin (records of To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple))," which is also called "To-ji Choja Shidai," is a set of documents describing the personnel affairs of past To-ji Choja.
To-ji Choja Bunin (records of To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple)), which is also called To-ji Choja Shidai, is a set of documents describing the personnel affairs of past To-ji Choja.

sen.j: 古くは11世紀半ばに仁海によって書かれた『仁海僧正自筆長者次第』などがあったといわれている。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that there existed "Ningai Sojo Jihitsu Choja Shidai" (the records of the To-ji Choja (chief abbot of To-ji Temple), self-written by Ningai Sojo (the high-ranking Buddhist priest)) in the middle of the eleventh century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 現存最古のものとしては37代長者寛信が20年の歳月をかけて久安元年（1145年）に完成した『東寺長者補任』2巻がある。
sen.e: It is said that there existed "Ningai Sojo Jihitsu Choja Shidai (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple) self-written by Ningai Sojo (the high-ranking Buddhist priest))" in the middle of the 11th century. The oldest extant one is two volumes of "To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple)," which the 37th Choja, Kanshin, spent 20 years to complete.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that there existed "Ningai Sojo Jihitsu Choja Shidai" (the records of the To-ji Choja (chief abbot of To-ji Temple), self-written by Ningai Sojo (the high-ranking Buddhist priest)) in the middle of the eleventh century; the oldest extant one, however, is two volumes of "To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple)," which Kanshin, the thirty-seventh Choja, completed over a period of 20 years.

The oldest extant one, however, is two volumes of "To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple)," which Kanshin, the thirty-seventh Choja, completed in 1145 over a period of 20 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処年号補足

sen.j: これには空海以来の歴代長者の任命日・俗姓・師資・年譜などが人別に記載されている。
sen.e: The records describe the dates of appointment, secular surnames, masters, disciples, and chronological records of respective past Choja.
The records describe the dates of appointments, secular surnames, masters, disciples and chronological records of the respective Choja.
The records describe the dates of appointments, secular surnames, masters, disciples and chronological records of the respective Choja since Kukai.

sen.j: 続いて寛元元年（1243年）頃に55代厳海までの師資・称号・俗姓・仁限・忌日などを記した選者不明の『東寺長者并高野検校等次第』1巻が著された。
sen.e: Then there is "To-ji choja Narabini Koya Kengyo To Shidai (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple), Koya Kengyo, and others)" of an unknown author, compiled in around 1243, describing the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen (仁限) and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja up to Gonkai, the 55th Choja.
sen.cmt: 用語集においても、Jingen (仁限)は、仮訳となっていますが、当方も確認できませんでした。
sen.e: There is also "To-ji choja Narabini Koya Kengyo To Shidai (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple), Koya Kengyo and Others)," by an unknown author and compiled in or around 1243, describing the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen (仁限) and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja up to Gonkai, the fifty-fifth Choja.

There is also "To-ji choja Narabini Koya Kengyo To Shidai" (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple), Koya Kengyo and Others), by an unknown author and compiled in or around 1243, describing the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja up to Gonkai, the fifty-fifth Choja.
sen.cmt: "位置移動(仁限)削除→翻訳者コメント同様

sen.j: その後、延文/正平_(日本)年間（1360年）頃に杲宝によって『東寺長者補任』5巻を撰した。
sen.e: After that in around 1360, Goho compiled five volumes of To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of the To-ji Temple).
Subsequently, in about 1360, Goho compiled five volumes of To-ji Choja Bunin (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple).
Subsequently, in about 1360, Goho compiled five volumes of "To-ji Choja Bunin" (records of the To-ji Choja (the chief abbot of To-ji Temple)).

sen.j: これには東寺の歴史、歴代長者の師資・称号・俗姓・仁限・忌日年譜などが詳細に記載されて長く東寺の基本史料とされた。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This contains a detailed history of To-ji Temple as well as the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja, and was used for many years as the basic historical record of To-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかも杲宝の原本に増補が加えられて300年後の寛永11年（1635年）の分まで加えられた。
sen.e: This contains in detail the history of the To-ji Temple, and the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen (仁限) and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja, and was used for many years as the basic historical materials of the To-ji Temple. In addition, additional information up to 1635 was added to the original version written by Goho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This contains a detailed history of To-ji Temple as well as the masters, disciples, titles, secular surnames, Jingen (仁限) and kinichi (death anniversaries) of past Choja, and was used for many years as the basic historical record of To-ji Temple; additionally, information up to 1635 was added to the original version written by Goho.
Additionally, information up to 1635 was added to the original version written by Goho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(仁限)削除→翻訳者コメント同様

sen.j: その一方で杲宝の原本が余りにも膨大になってしまったために簡便な抄本版と言える貞治6年/正平22年（1367年）までの『東寺長者補任』1巻も作成された。
sen.e: On the other hand, because the original version written by Goho became too voluminous, a handy abridged version of "To-ji Choja Bunin" volume 1 covering up to 1367 was also compiled.
On the other hand, because the original version written by Goho had become too unwieldy, a more convenient abridged version of "To-ji Choja Bunin" Volume 1, covering up to 1367, was also compiled.
On the other hand, because the original version written by Goho had become too unwieldy, a more convenient abridged version of "To-ji Choja Bunin" Volume 1, covering up to 1367, was also compiled.
